At a distance, far away, remote, alien. Feminine accusative case singular of makros; at a distance.
Probably from a primary verb eiro; peace; by implication, prosperity.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Near. From a primary verb agcho; near.

18.str2: Neuter of hostis as conjunction; demonstrative, that; causative, because.
A primary preposition denoting the channel of an act; through.

18.parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Singular
18.str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.

18.parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 1st Person Plural
18.str2: To have, hold, possess. Including an alternate form scheo skheh'-o; a primary verb; to hold.
Approach, access, admission. From prosago; admission.
To, towards, with. A strengthened form of pro; a preposition of direction; forward to, i.e. Toward.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Father, (Heavenly) Father, ancestor, elder, senior. Apparently a primary word; a 'father'.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
One. (including the neuter Hen); a primary numeral; one.

19.str2: Then, therefore, since. Probably from airo; a particle denoting an inference more or less decisive.

19.parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 2nd Person Plural
19.str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
No longer, no more. Also ouk eti from ou and eti; not yet, no longer.
Apparently a primary word; foreign; by implication, a guest or entertainer.
Foreign, alien, subst: a foreigner, sojourner. From para and oikos; having a home near, i.e. a by-dweller.
But, except, however. Neuter plural of allos; properly, other things, i.e. contrariwise.
A fellow citizen. From sun and polites; a native of the same town, i.e. co-religionist.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Set apart by (or for) God, holy, sacred. From hagos; sacred.
Of one's family, domestic, intimate. From oikos; domestic, i.e., a relative, adherent.

20.parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Passive - Nominative Masculine Plural
20.str2: To build upon (above) a foundation. From epi and oikodomeo; to build upon, i.e. to rear up.
On, to, against, on the basis of, at.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From a derivative of tithemi; something put down, i.e. A substruction.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From apostello; a delegate; specially, an ambassador of the Gospel; officially a commissioner of Christ.
From a compound of pro and phemi; a foreteller; by analogy, an inspired speaker; by extension, a poet.
Anointed One; the Messiah, the Christ. From chrio; Anointed One, i.e. The Messiah, an epithet of Jesus.
Of Hebrew origin; Jesus, the name of our Lord and two other Israelites.

20.parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Singular
20.str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.

20.parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Genitive Masculine Singular
20.str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
In the corner (of a building); subst: corner-(stone). From akron and gonia; belonging to the extreme corner.

21.str2: In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.

21.parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Dative Masculine Singular

21.str2: All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.
Feminine of a compound of oikos and the base of doma; architecture, i.e. a structure; figuratively, confirmation.

21.parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Nominative Feminine Singular
21.str2: From sun and a derivative of a compound of harmos and lego; to render close-jointed together, i.e. Organize compactly.

21.parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
21.str2: (a) I cause to increase, become greater (b) I increase, grow. A prolonged form of a primary verb; to grow, i.e. Enlarge.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
Set apart by (or for) God, holy, sacred. From hagos; sacred.
A temple, a shrine, that part of the temple where God himself resides. From a primary naio; a fane, shrine, temple.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
Lord, master, sir; the Lord. From kuros; supreme in authority, i.e. controller; by implication, Master.

22.str2: In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.

22.parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Dative Masculine Singular
Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Nominative 2nd Person Plural
22.str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.

22.parse: Verb - Present Indicative Middle or Passive - 2nd Person Plural
22.str2: To build together with. From sun and oikodomeo; to construct, i.e. to compose.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
A habitation, dwelling-place, abode. From a derivative of katoikeo; a dwelling-place.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
